com.camerontec.util.data

Class SafeBufferOnByteArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.data.AbstractBuffer
      • com.camerontec.util.data.AbstractSafeBuffer
        • com.camerontec.util.data.SafeBufferOnByteArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Buffer, BufferOnByteArray

    public final class SafeBufferOnByteArray
extends AbstractSafeBuffer
implements BufferOnByteArray
    A Buffer implementation which uses an on heap byte array as its backing store.

    Range checking is performed but operations guarantee not to throw exceptions when there would otherwise by out of range, underflow or overflow conditions. Please consider whether this is useful in your situation or not.

    This class is not thread safe.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SafeBufferOnByteArray

        public SafeBufferOnByteArray()
        Constructor.

      • SafeBufferOnByteArray

        public SafeBufferOnByteArray(byte[] array)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        array - An NIO byte buffer. Can be either direct or indirect. May not be null. The byte buffer is cleared (i.e. its position equals 0 and its limit equals its capacity), but the data (if any) is retained.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the byte buffer is null.
